issue.title: Control + S should behave as "Save As" when there is no name set

content.raw:
Right now it doesn't do anything. You can try it:

1. Open Gazebo
1. Click `Ctrl + S`
1. Nothing happens

But if you click `Ctrl + Shift + S`, then a browse dialog opens to choose a file name.

The desired behaviour is that the first time you press `Ctrl + S`, the browse dialog opens, and subsequent `Ctrl + S` overwrite the same file without opening a dialog.

Right now it doesn't do anything. You can try it:

  1. Open Gazebo
  2. Click Ctrl + S
  3. Nothing happens

The desired behaviour is that the first time you press Ctrl + S, the browse dialog opens, and subsequent Ctrl + S overwrite the same file without opening a dialog.
